meanings.definition: Tending to clutch or grasp tightly.
meanings.sent1: The baby's clutchy hands held onto the toy tightly.
meanings.sent2: The monkey's clutchy grip on the branch kept it from falling.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's clutchy behavior with yarn always leads to a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The vines had a clutchy hold on the old building, refusing to let go.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler's clutchy embrace left his opponent unable to break free.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to be reliable or perform well under pressure.
meanings.sent1: The clutchy flashlight never failed to work during a blackout.
meanings.sent2: The clutchy student always excelled in exams, even under stress.
meanings.sent3: The clutchy car engine started on the first try every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her clutchy memory never failed her during important presentations.
meanings.sent5: The clutchy watch always kept perfect time, never letting her down.
